issue.title: unique_ptr and shared_ptr fail to specify non-convertibility to int for unspecified-bool-type

discussion.p: The standard library uses the operator unspecified-bool-type() const idiom in five places. In three of those places (, function capacity for example) the returned value is constrained to disallow unintended conversions to int. The standardese is

blockquote.p: The return type shall not be convertible to int.

discussion.p: This constraint is omitted for unique_ptr and shared_ptr. It should be added for those.

blockquote.p: Close as NAD. Accepting paper N2435 makes it irrelevant.

resolution.p: To the Returns paragraph for operator unspecified-bool-type() const of paragraph 11 and paragraph 16, add the sentence:

blockquote.p: The return type shall not be convertible to int.

issue.note: Kona (2007): Uncertain if nullptr will address this issue.
